de.dimensionv.android.widget.dashboardlayout

Class ContainerDashboardItem<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dimensionv.android.widget.dashboardlayout.SimpleDashboardItem
      • de.dimensionv.android.widget.dashboardlayout.ContainerDashboardItem<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    View.OnClickListener, DashboardItem

    public class ContainerDashboardItem<T>
extends SimpleDashboardItem

    DashboardItem implementation extending the SimpleDashboardItem by the capability to act as a container for the actual object (the content-object) that should appear in the DashboardLayout.

    If this content-object also implements the DashboardItemContent interface, the data required for representing a true DashboardItem, like ID, displayed text and the icons, is extracted from the content-object.

    Since:
    API 1.0.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContainerDashboardItem

        public ContainerDashboardItem(T content,
                      boolean enabled)

        Creates a new ContainerDashboardItem from the given content-object, and sets it into the state given by the parameter enabled.

        For this constructor to work properly, context needs to implement the DashboardItemContent-interface. If it does not, this constructor will throw a ClassCastException.

        Parameters:
        content - The content-object to be used and added. Must implement the DashboardItemContent-interface.
        enabled - The state that defines whether the item is active and clickable (true) or not (false).
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - A ClassCastException will be thrown in case the content-object does not implement the DashboardItemContent interface.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0

      • ContainerDashboardItem

        public ContainerDashboardItem(long id,
                      String text,
                      Drawable iconEnabled,
                      Drawable iconDisabled)

        Creates a new ContainerDashboardItem from the given parameters.

        This is one of the constructors that should be used in case the content-object does not implement the DashboardItemContent interface.

        This constructor does not set the content-object

        This constructor creates the item as "enabled", which means it will be active and clickable.

        Parameters:
        id - The ID of this item (required for later identification when an item gets clicked upon).
        text - The text the should show up under the icon in the dashboard.
        iconEnabled - The icon for the enabled == true state.
        iconDisabled - The icon for the enabled == false state.
        Since:
        Class 1.0, API 1.0.0
